Home → New suggestions → Reviews → Page → Reviews

Reviews

Read staff and customer reviews of books and reserve to collect from your library, or download to your device.

Days Without End by Sebastian Barry

Written by Sue Orton · Published Dec 19, 2019

Days Without End is a truly memorable story of a life spent trying to survive.

The Sea House by Esther Freud

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Dec 3, 2019

The Sea House is well-written and enjoyable, with a familiar setting.

Snap by Belinda Bauer

Written by Chantry Journeys reading group · Published Nov 26, 2019

Snap is a fast-moving, enjoyable read featuring likeable characters and lots of twists.

The Library Book by Susan Orlean

Written by Sue Orton · Published Nov 21, 2019

The Library Book is an unusual and fascinating read.

The Dressmaker by Rosalie Ham

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Oct 3, 2019

The Dressmaker is well-written, blends humour and sadness, and features lovely and outrageous characters.

The Crooked House by Christobel Kent

Written by Sue Orton · Published Sep 17, 2019

The Crooked House is a deeply engrossing and hugely enjoyable thriller.

Just Mercy: a story of justice and redemption by Bryan Stevenson

Written by Chantry Journeys reading group · Published Sep 10, 2019

Just Mercy is well-written, harrowing and unforgettable.

The Hours Before Dawn by Celia Fremlin

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Aug 29, 2019

The Hours Before Dawn is a menacing and very cleverly written psychological thriller.

Brick Lane by Monica Ali

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jul 23, 2019

Brick Lane is a powerful, enjoyable, well-written book that sparked a lot of discussion.

The Last Hours by Minette Walters

Written by Sue Orton · Published Jun 11, 2019

The Last Hours is interesting and well-researched.
